t: Proverbs 2
Moral Benefits of Wisdom
My*pn son, if you accept my words and*ld store up my commands within you,
turning*ln your ear to wisdom and*ld applying your heart to understanding—
indeed,*ln if you call out for insight and*ld cry aloud for understanding,
and*ln if you look for it as for silver and*ld search for it as for hidden treasure,
then*ln you will understand the fear of the Lord*s and*ld find the knowledge of God.
For*ln the Lord*s gives wisdom; from*ld his mouth come knowledge and understanding.
He*ln holds success in store for the upright, he*ld is a shield to those whose walk is blameless,
for*ln he guards the course of the just and*ld protects the way of his faithful ones.
Then*pn you will understand what is right and just and*ld fair—every good path.
For*ln wisdom will enter your heart, and*ld knowledge will be pleasant to your soul.
Discretion*ln will protect you, and*ld understanding will guard you.
Wisdom*pn will save you from the ways of wicked men, from*ld men whose words are perverse,
who*ln have left the straight paths to*ld walk in dark ways,
who*ln delight in doing wrong and*ld rejoice in the perverseness of evil,
whose*ln paths are crooked and*ld who are devious in their ways.
Wisdom*pn will save you also from the adulterous woman, from*ld the wayward woman with her seductive words,
who*ln has left the partner of her youth and*ld ignored the covenant she made before God.
Surely*ln her house leads down to death and*ld her paths to the spirits of the dead.
None*ln who go to her return or*ld attain the paths of life.
Thus*pn you will walk in the ways of the good and*ld keep to the paths of the righteous.
For*ln the upright will live in the land, and*ld the blameless will remain in it;
but*ln the wicked will be cut off from the land, and*ld the unfaithful will be torn from it.
